intro: Stemonurus oppositifolius, commonly known as the opposite-leaved stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of simple, elliptical leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Stemonurus oppositifolius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
